sentences.english: If you need to leave during your service period you should first report to a responsible person.
sentences.chinese: 服务期间，因故离院需向负责老师请假登记。

sentences.english: Sixth, like the second party changes for some reason, the first party does not return the rent.
sentences.chinese: 如乙方因故变动，甲方不退还租金。

sentences.english: There will be NO refund of the registration fee if the registered participants do not attend the forum.
sentences.chinese: 缴纳注册费后，若因故不能出席论坛将不获退款。

sentences.english: The initiative to cancel, for some reason can not stay, call in advance to cancel.
sentences.chinese: 主动取消，因故不能入住，可提前电话取消。

sentences.english: If anybody can not attend the conference, please inform the conference services staff.
sentences.chinese: 因故不能参加，应先请假，并告知会务组。

sentences.english: This week's Intermediate Class will be postponed to next week!
sentences.chinese: 本周中级班因故暂停一周，下周三继续上课。

sentences.english: Those in block have been canceled due to absence of the aircraft at the show.
sentences.chinese: 方框内的机型因故已经取消参展表演。

sentences.english: Jacky Cheung got the Best Actor Award at India Movie Festival.
sentences.chinese: 此外，最佳男配角黄秋生也因故没有参颁奖。

sentences.english: Given one party could not present on the scene due to some reasons, the written Letter of Entrustment shall be submitted.
sentences.chinese: 收养人一方因故不能到场的，应出具书面委托书。

sentences.english: Games such as the reason can not be held, the Olympic Games are still a few sessions in accordance with the continuation of calculation.
sentences.chinese: 运动会如因故不能举行，奥运会的届数仍照延续计算。

sentences.english: They had wanted to help but couldn't get here in time.
sentences.chinese: 他们本来是要来帮忙的，但因故未能来成。

definition: to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
(to do sth) separately/as a separate action
as the time draws near/at the last moment/temporary/interim/ad hoc
to expire/to run out/to come to an end
to shut down/to terminate/to cancel/to go out of business
according to provisions/as stipulated in the rules
